section.p: Clinical documents commonly have 'Subjective' and 'Objective' findings, both of which are kinds of Observations. In addition, clinical documents commonly contain 'Assessments', which are also kinds of Observations. Thus, the establishment of a diagnosis is an Observation.

ol.li:
Contains exactly one [1..1] ageAtDeath with data type Physical Quantity
Contains the age of the patient at the time of death.

Contains exactly one [1..1] autopsyDate with data type Point In Time
The date and time when the autopsy assessment is completed. Also the date of the final diagnosis of cause of death.

Contains exactly one [1..1] autopsyType with data type Code
Anatomical areas of the body the autopsy is performed on. This can be as broad as a full autopsy or grouping of the body region such as chest, trunk, head. lower body.

Contains exactly one [1..1] clinicalDiagnoses with data type String
Contains information in textual format about the autopsy.

Contains exactly one [1..1] comments with data type String
Contains information in textual format about the autopsy.

Contains exactly one [1..1] dateOfDeath with data type Point In Time
This is the date and time of the death of the patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] dxClarificationCode with data type Code
Contains the Code value to indicate whether the clinical dx insufficient (ex. Intracranial hemorrhage) did autopsy clarify the dx (ex. ruptured aneurysm) ? '1' FOR YES; '0' FOR NO; '2' FOR CONFIRMED;

Contains exactly one [1..1] finalDiagnosisDate with data type Point In Time
This is the date and time the final diagnosis was given.

Contains exactly one [1..1] isMajorDxDisagreement with data type Boolean
Contains the Code value to indicate whether there is major disagreement with the clinical Diagnoses. 0 = No 1 = Yes.

Contains exactly one [1..1] pathologicalDiagnoses with data type String
These are the pathological diagnoses in textual format.

Contains exactly one [1..1] provisionalDiagnosisDate with data type Point In Time
Contains the date provisional anatomic diagnoses reported.

Contains exactly one [1..1] serviceCode with data type Code
Contains the code set that identifies the reason for autopsy service performed.

Contains zero or one [0..1] autopsyAssistant, where its type is Individual Provider
Identifies the Autopsy Assistant that is performing the autopsy.
The practitioner who assisted in performing the autopsy.

Contains zero or more [0..*] diagnosis, where its type is Diagnosis
Contains the Diagnosis of the patient health Issue for the episode of care.
An association from AutopsyEvent2 to Diagnosis identifying a dignosis associated to the autopsy event.

Contains zero or more [0..*] document, where its type is _ Autopsy Document Reference
The text of the report in it's entirety, as signed by the practitioner. Can also mean the text that comprises the report section.
An association from AutopayEvent2 to AutopsyDocumnetReference identifying the document referencing the autopsy.

Contains zero or more [0..*] grossImage, where its type is Image
Images associated with Autopsy Organ/Tissue reports are stored in this multiple within the Autopsy Organ/Tissue field of the Lab Data (#63) file.
Images associated with Autopsy Organ/Tissue reports are stored in this multiple within the Autopsy Organ/Tissue field of the Lab Data (#63) file.

Contains at least one [1..*] measurement, where its type is _ Anatomic Measurement
Measurement value is the actual value of the result and its unit of measure.

Contains zero or one [0..1] microscopicImage, where its type is Image
Images associated with Autopsy Organ/Tissue reports are stored in this multiple within the Autopsy Organ/Tissue field of the Lab Data file.
Images associated with Autopsy Organ/Tissue reports are stored in this multiple within the Autopsy Organ/Tissue field of the Lab Data file.

Contains exactly one [1..1] residentPathologist, where its type is Individual Provider
Resident Pathologist who authored the autopsy assessment.

Contains exactly one [1..1] seniorPathologist, where its type is Individual Provider
Senior Pathologist who verified and approved autopsy assessment.

Contains zero or one [0..1] treatingSpecialtyAtDeath, where its type is Facility Treating Specialty
Contains the name of treating specialty at time of patient's death.
An association from AutopsyEvent2 to FacilityTreatingSpeciality identifying the Treating specialist at death.

Contains exactly one [1..1] ageAtDeath with data type Physical Quantity
Contains the age of the patient at the time of death.

Contains exactly one [1..1] autopsyDate with data type Point In Time
The date and time when the autopsy assessment is completed. Also the date of the final diagnosis of cause of death.

Contains exactly one [1..1] autopsyType with data type Code
Anatomical areas of the body the autopsy is performed on. This can be as broad as a full autopsy or grouping of the body region such as chest, trunk, head. lower body.

Contains exactly one [1..1] clinicalDiagnoses with data type String
Contains information in textual format about the autopsy.

Contains exactly one [1..1] comments with data type String
Contains information in textual format about the autopsy.

Contains exactly one [1..1] dateOfDeath with data type Point In Time
This is the date and time of the death of the patient.

Contains the Code value to indicate whether the clinical dx insufficient (ex. Intracranial hemorrhage) did autopsy clarify the dx (ex. ruptured aneurysm) ? '1' FOR YES; '0' FOR NO; '2' FOR CONFIRMED;

Contains exactly one [1..1] finalDiagnosisDate with data type Point In Time
This is the date and time the final diagnosis was given.

Contains the Code value to indicate whether there is major disagreement with the clinical Diagnoses. 0 = No 1 = Yes.

Contains exactly one [1..1] pathologicalDiagnoses with data type String
These are the pathological diagnoses in textual format.

Contains the code set that identifies the reason for autopsy service performed.

Contains zero or one [0..1] autopsyAssistant, where its type is Individual Provider
Identifies the Autopsy Assistant that is performing the autopsy.
The practitioner who assisted in performing the autopsy.

Images associated with Autopsy Organ/Tissue reports are stored in this multiple within the Autopsy Organ/Tissue field of the Lab Data (#63) file.

Resident Pathologist who authored the autopsy assessment.

Senior Pathologist who verified and approved autopsy assessment.

Contains the name of treating specialty at time of patient's death.
